alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 5:44AM EST until January 30 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From late tonight to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:29 AM EST Thursday the stage was 114.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fluctuate around flood stage at 115 feet today and then rise tonight to a crest of 118.8 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EST.
